data: ICU Organ Donation Neurological Determination of Death (NDD)
Consent for donation must be obtained by BC Transplant Service (BCTS) Coordinator
Ensure that Neurological Determination of Death (NDD) is performed by 2 attending physicians
See BC Transplant Physical Assessment Form
Change medical service to deceased donor after first declaration of death

SBP Goal: _____ mmHg, Temp 34 to 35 DegC, pH goal: 7.35 to 7.45, PaO2 goal: greater than 70 mmHg with minimal effective FiO2, CVP goal: 6 to 10 mmHg, Hgb Goal: above 70 g/L, SaO2: greater than or equal to 95% , urine output 0.5 to 3 mL/kg/h
once, record on BC Transplant Physical Assessment Form
once, record on BC Transplant Physical Assessment Form
q1h, urine output goal 0.5 to 3 mL/kg/h
Monitor core temperature continuously via esophageal or rectal probe and document q1h
Goal temperature: Other (please specify), by BairHugger, 34.0 to 35.0 DegC
Goal temperature: Other (please specify), by CritiCool device, 34.0 to 35.0 DegC
Goal temperature: Other (please specify), by overhead warmer, 34.0 to 35.0 DegC
Hgb < 70, Plts < 10, Notify Provider and BC Transplant
Indwelling, if not already in place
NG-tube, to low intermittent suction, if feeds contraindicated or not tolerated
OG-tube, to low intermittent suction if feeds contraindicated or not tolerated
Hold feeds 8 hours prior to recovery surgery
80%  of Maintenance Fluids, Including PO and Enteral Meds/Fluids, Including IV Continuous infusions/Fluids, Including IV Intermittent Meds
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag

vasopressin titratable infusion - maximum dose 40 milliunit/min
vasopressin PED ICU titratable infusion (0.4 unit/mL) below 6 kg  in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.03 milliunit/kg/min starting rate, 0 milliunit/kg/min minimum rate, 2 milliunit/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP
vasopressin PED ICU titratable infusion (1 unit/mL)  6 kg and above in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.03 milliunit/kg/min starting rate, 0 milliunit/kg/min minimum rate, 2 milliunit/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP
epinephrine titratable infusion - maximum dose 1 mcg/kg/min
epinephrine PED ICU titratable infusion (25 mcg/mL) 2 to 6 kg in NS
titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP
epinephrine PED ICU titratable infusion (50 mcg/mL)  6 to 30 kg in NS
titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP

titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP

titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min, minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP

titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min, minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP

titrate, IV, 0.01 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min, minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP

Age-related treatment thresholds for arterial hypertension:
- Newborns to 3 months: greater than 90/60 mmHg
- 3 months to 1 year: greater than 110/70 mmHg
- 1 year to 12 years: greater than 130/80 mmHg
- 12 years to 18 years: greater than 140/90 mmHg
Wean inotropes and vasopressors, and start nitroprusside OR esmolol if not at desired target BP after wean
nitroprusside PED ICU titratable infusion (200 mcg/mL) below 10 kg in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.5 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 5 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired SBP
nitroprusside PED ICU titratable infusion (800 mcg/mL) 10 to 50 kg in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.5 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 5 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired SBP
nitroprusside PED ICU titratable infusion (2000 mcg/mL) 50 kg and above in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.5 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 5 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired SBP
nitroprusside PED ICU titratable infusion (5000 mcg/mL) 50 kg and above in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.5 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 5 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired SBP
500 mcg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 2  min, drug form: inj
esmolol PED ICU titratable infusion (10 mg/mL)
titrate, IV, 50 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 300 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired SBP

MD to confirm diagnosis. Defined as urine output greater than 3 mL/kg/h associated with:
- increasing serum sodium greater than 145 mmol/L, and/or
- increasing serum osmolarity greater than 300 mosM, and/or
- decreasing urine osmolarity less than or equal to 200 mosM
If Diabetes Insipidus present without hypertension, titrate vasopressin therapy to urine output less than 3 mL/kg/h. Maximum dose 0.2 milliunit/kg/min
vasopressin PED ICU titratable infusion (0.4 unit/mL) below 6 kg  in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.02 milliunit/kg/min starting rate, 0 milliunit/kg/min minimum rate, 0.05 millliunit/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to urine output less than 3 mL/kg/h
vasopressin PED ICU titratable infusion (1 unit/mL)  6 kg and above in D5W
titrate, IV, 0.02 milliunit/kg/min starting rate, 0 milliunit/kg/min minimum rate, 0.05 millliunit/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to urine output less than 3 mL/kg/h
Give levothyroxine for cardiac donor. Dose is not weight based. Discontinue if heart no longer under evaluation
100 mcg, IV, once, drug form: inj
50 mcg, IV, q12h interval, drug form: inj, start:  T;N+720
Consult with pharmacy for renal dosing of all antibiotics in presence of impaired renal function
If lungs not being considered for transplant, treat any known or suspected infections
If lungs are being considered for transplant, treat with vancomycin AND fluconazole AND [piperacillin-tazobactam OR meropenem]
15 mg/kg, IV, q6h interval, order duration: 7 day
6 mg/kg, IV, q24h, order duration: 7 day
75 mg/kg, IV, q6h interval, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
For documented or suspected penicillin anaphylaxis or history of Extended Spectrum Beta-Lactamase organisms, select meropenem
20 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, order duration: 7 day
Send blood for tissue typing and serology (Use BC Transplant "Red Blood Box")
